docs.lead_paragraph: The fate of five men who ventured into South Dakota's Black Hills--the sacred Paha Sapa of the Lakota Sioux--was scrawled in Ezra Kind's last note: "All kilt but me." That small expedition in 1835 was probably ...

headline.main: HIGH NOON IN THE BLACK HILLS

docs.abstract: Peter Matthiessen article on past and proposed uranium mining around Edgemont in Black Hills of South Dakota and growing opposition to it among Indians, environmentalists and ranchers; discusses Indian land claims, threat to environment posed by each stage of uranium development, and threat to region's water supply; notes Black Hills Alliance's effort to organize opposition; illus (L)
